channel.title: Xfire Game Detection Patcher
channel.description:
I started making this program after I found out I could simply patch xfire's files to make xfire detect games it wouldn't previously detect. I found out that it nuked the changes to the file after each update, so that's why I wrote this program.
You can find everything [url=http://jxpatch.wurmunited.com/]here[/url]. Everything in the nl dir is made by me, save for a snippet of code I used to detect the Xfire dir in the registry.

item.title: Xfire Game Detection Patcher
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:1, topic:266478”]I started making this program after I found out I could simply patch xfire’s files to make xfire detect games it wouldn’t previously detect.
I found out that it nuked the changes to the file after each update, so that’s why I wrote this program.

You can find everything here.
Everything in the nl dir is made by me, save for a snippet of code I used to detect the Xfire dir in the registry.[/quote]

[quote=“Ollie, post:8, topic:266478”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=351929.msg2702188#msg2702188 date=1236708806]

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=351929.msg2701619#msg2701619 date=1236643191]

Goodjob, I will test this in my sandbox.
[/quote]wow arent you the leet haxor

too bad the jvm is a sandbox eh

I refer to my VM of Windows XP as my sandbox; he specified this is a program with a proprietary OS (Windows), since I only run Linux as a host, I would have to test this in a VM’d XP.
[/quote][quote author=frank_ link=topic=351929.msg2700746#msg2700746 date=1236574720]
wow arent you the leet haxor

Nope, just someone who wants to run multiple OS’s without having to reboot.
[/quote][quote author=frank_ link=topic=351929.msg2700746#msg2700746 date=1236574720]
wow arent you the leet haxor[/quote][/quote]

The program was written for Windows, so I used Windows; I am not quite sure why you all are making a big deal of it.

Read full topic
